meanings.definition: A noble or high-ranking official in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The ealdorman was respected by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The ealdorman held great power and influence in the land.
meanings.sent3: The ealdorman's hat flew off in the wind, causing laughter among the villagers.
meanings.sent4: His presence at the meeting was like that of an ealdorman overseeing his domain.
meanings.sent5: The ealdorman's regal attire shimmered in the sunlight, a symbol of his authority.

meanings.definition: A title of nobility in early medieval England.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient tales, the ealdorman was always portrayed as a wise and just ruler.
meanings.sent2: The ealdorman's lineage traced back to the earliest days of the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be an ealdorman, wearing a makeshift crown.
meanings.sent4: Her grace and poise at the ball made her seem like an ealdorman's daughter.
meanings.sent5: The title of ealdorman carried with it a sense of duty and honor.
